reference.title: Enabling remote JMX with password authentication only

section.p: Some JVMs include built-in support for JMX password authentication. For example, with Oracle Java Development Kit (JDK) 6 or later, authentication is enabled by default, and it is possible to specify a properties file that contains usernames and passwords. The properties file syntax is the same as for other Java properties files.

p.note: When authentication is enabled and a Java Security Manager is installed, additional permissions may need to be granted to users in the security policy used. See for details.
